title: The "make all" command fails on Ubuntu 20.04 - /go/pkg/mod/github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go-v2/service/route53@v1.1.1/deserializers.go:671:36: response.Response.Header.Values undefined (type "net/http".Header has no field or method Values)
body:
Starting from this Dockerfile:
```
FROM ubuntu:20.04

# Prepare a base Ubuntu image
RUN apt-get update
RUN export DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends --fix-missing openssh-server vim build-essential git golang ca-certificates iputils-ping curl netcat nodejs npm
RUN npm install -g n && n lts

# Clone this repo and build it
RUN git clone https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum
RUN cd go-ethereum && make all
```

#### Expected behaviour
The `make all` command, taken from the README.md of this repo, succeeds.

#### Actual behaviour
```
...
#14 147.1 github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go-v2/service/route53/types
#14 147.6 github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go-v2/credentials/stscreds
#14 147.7 github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go-v2/config
#14 147.7 github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go-v2/service/route53/internal/customizations
#14 147.8 github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go-v2/service/route53/internal/endpoints
#14 147.8 github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go-v2/service/route53
#14 148.1 # github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go-v2/service/route53
#14 148.1 ../go/pkg/mod/github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go-v2/service/route53@v1.1.1/deserializers.go:671:36: response.Response.Header.Values undefined (type "net/http".Header has no field or method Values)
#14 148.1 ../go/pkg/mod/github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go-v2/service/route53@v1.1.1/deserializers.go:849:36: response.Response.Header.Values undefined (type "net/http".Header has no field or method Values)
#14 148.1 ../go/pkg/mod/github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go-v2/service/route53@v1.1.1/deserializers.go:1048:36: response.Response.Header.Values undefined (type "net/http".Header has no field or method Values)
#14 148.1 ../go/pkg/mod/github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go-v2/service/route53@v1.1.1/deserializers.go:1223:36: response.Response.Header.Values undefined (type "net/http".Header has no field or method Values)
#14 148.1 ../go/pkg/mod/github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go-v2/service/route53@v1.1.1/deserializers.go:1395:36: response.Response.Header.Values undefined (type "net/http".Header has no field or method Values)
#14 148.1 ../go/pkg/mod/github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go-v2/service/route53@v1.1.1/deserializers.go:1558:36: response.Response.Header.Values undefined (type "net/http".Header has no field or method Values)
#14 148.1 ../go/pkg/mod/github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go-v2/service/route53@v1.1.1/deserializers.go:1724:36: response.Response.Header.Values undefined (type "net/http".Header has no field or method Values)
#14 148.1 ../go/pkg/mod/github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go-v2/service/route53@v1.1.1/deserializers.go:1890:36: response.Response.Header.Values undefined (type "net/http".Header has no field or method Values)
#14 148.1 note: module requires Go 1.15
#14 148.1 golang.org/x/text/unicode/bidi
#14 148.4 github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/internal/utesting
#14 148.4 golang.org/x/text/secure/bidirule
#14 148.4 golang.org/x/net/idna
#14 148.5 github.com/pmezard/go-difflib/difflib
#14 148.6 gopkg.in/yaml.v3
#14 148.7 github.com/cloudflare/cloudflare-go
#14 149.8 net/http/httptest
#14 150.0 github.com/stretchr/testify/assert
#14 150.6 github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/cmd/devp2p/internal/v4test
#14 150.8 github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/cmd/devp2p/internal/v5test
#14 150.9 github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/cmd/devp2p/internal/ethtest
#14 151.2 util.go:47: exit status 2
#14 151.2 exit status 1
#14 151.2 make: *** [Makefile:21: all] Error 1
------
executor failed running [/bin/sh -c cd go-ethereum && make geth && make all]: exit code: 2
```

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
`docker build . -t go-ethereum-test`
My guess is that the Go version bundled in stock Ubuntu is ancient. You'll need to either download a recent version of Go into your builder, or use the `golang` base image for your docker builder.
`Header.Values()` was added in Go 1.14. The current version is 1.16. You seem to be 3 releases behind (2+ years). Please update.
Thank you so much for this useful information.
